intro: Nigrina rhinanthodes, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are bright yellow with five petals. Nigrina rhinanthodes is an important species for pollinators and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
